title: Miley Cyrus broke it off with Kaitlynn Carter because it was moving too fast
text:
Too much of a good thing Pictures: Getty/REX

Miley Cyrus apparently ended things with Kaitlynn Carter because their relationship was moving too fast with the pair having spoken about marriage.

There was no cheating or fighting involved in Miley’s decision to break things off after a whirlwind romance where she and Kaitlynn were practically inseparable, according to TMZ.

Following break-ups with their respective husbands, Liam Hemsworth and Brody Jenner, the 26-year-old pop singer was seen soaking up the sunshine and attention of Kaitlynn on a vacay in Italy in mid-August.

The two women who ‘got along like a house on fire’ then moved in together in early September and apparently there was even talk of marriage!

The two were even seen couple dressing at times (Picture: Backgrid)

But as things got increasingly hot and heavy, sources said Miley realised she wasn’t ready to hop back into another committed relationship so soon, which is entirely relatable.

Kaitlynn seems to be still on reasonably good terms with Miley despite the breakup, and said she’s not bothered’ by the Wrecking Ball singer’s new fling with Australian singer Cody Simpson.

However, the 31-year-old has reportedly expressed concern ‘over Miley’s behaviour’ to friends and is ‘worried for her well-being.’

Going deeper still, a cryptic Insta post from the The Hills star had some asking if the message was related to Miley.

‘I may never know/understand what someone is going through but I always choose to look at other’s behaviour from a place of love and respect and compassion and be kind no matter what.’

Is this the tea? (Picture: Instagram)

A previous statement a source told People Miley ended things to ‘focus on her career’. It said: ‘Miley doesn’t want a serious relationship. She and Kaitlynn spent every day together and it just wasn’t anything that Miley wanted to continue doing.’

Meanwhile, Miley is making the most of the single life, slamming those who have tried to slut-shame her and addressing the double standards about men being able to move on quickly without judgement: ‘Get used to me dating – this is where I am at!’

The We Can’t Stop hitmaker is also taking this new chapter in her life to reflect on her achievements, celebrating six years of her infamous album Bangerz which changed her life forever.

‘Here’s to 6 more years of p***ing people off,’ she wrote in an Instagram post.

And she seems keen to channel her creativity into making some more music, sharing snaps of herself in a studio.

Frankly we can’t wait.
